intro: Pentapogon hirtellus, commonly known as the hairy pentapogon, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its hairy stems and leaves are distinctive features that aid in identification. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
